content: Solicitor-General of Singapore **Koh Juat Jong** [SC](/wiki/Senior_Counsel) ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 韩月榕; born 1959 or 1960) is a Singaporean judge who served as Solicitor-General of Singapore between 2008 and 2014. ## Early life Koh attended [CHIJ Saint Nicholas Girls' School](/wiki/CHIJ_Saint_Nicholas_Girls%27_School) and [National Junior College](/wiki/National_Junior_College), and was named a [President's Scholar](/wiki/President%27s_Scholar) in 1978. She graduated with a [Bachelor of Science](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Science) in economics and statistics from [University College London](/wiki/University_College_London) in 1981. She then joined the Administrative Service. She obtained her [Bachelor of Laws](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Laws) from the [National University of Singapore Faculty of Law](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore_Faculty_of_Law) in 1988 and her [Master of Laws](/wiki/Master_of_Laws) from [Harvard Law School](/wiki/Harvard_Law_School) in 1989. ## Career Between 1981 and 1986, Koh joined the Administrative Service and served in the [Ministry of Finance](/wiki/Ministry_of_Finance_(Singapore)) dealing with tax policies and personnel policies. Koh joined the [Attorney-General's Chambers](/wiki/Attorney-General_of_Singapore) as a [State Counsel](/wiki/State_Counsel) before being posted to the Supreme Court as a Senior Assistant Registrar. In 1995, she was appointed a District Judge and subsequently became the Principal District Judge, Family and Juvenile Justice Division. In 2003, she became Registrar of the Supreme Court; five years later, she was appointed the first female Solicitor-General in 2008. She was [Acting Attorney-General](/wiki/Attorney-General_of_Singapore) for five months in 2010 during a leadership transition. Koh was awarded the [Public Administration Medal](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam) (Gold) during the National Day Awards in 2005 and the Public Administration Medal (Gold) (Bar) during the National Day Awards in 2011. She retired from her appointment of [Solicitor General](/wiki/Solicitor_General) on 31 Jan 2014. - Koh Juat Jong's profile on the Singapore Attorney-General's Chambers website This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This Asian law-related biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Koh Juat Jong
